page.title: 03HOUSING IN EAST MERSEA
page.content: In the village the housing stock is varied in age and style but the houses are predominantly privately owned.From the census 75% of dwellings were owner-occupied,11.5% were council owned, 6% were tied properties and the rest were rented.A visual survey found that most of the houses were detached(81%) the rest were mainly semi-detached; over 80% of the houses had gardens,most of which were large;65% had outbuidings such as sheds or greenhouses;72% had garages reflecting the high car-ownership in the village. Houses varied from large old farmhouses and small farm-workers cottages to newly-built detached family homes.At Coopers' Beach there are several hundred privately-owned caravans and chalets used as holiday homes.
